current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to
		  exempt the conduct of silvicultural activities from national pollutant
		  discharge elimination system permitting requirements.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Environment and Public
			 Works

cosponsor.#tail:
)
			 introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by
			 adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 402(l) of
			 the Federal Water Pollution Control Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				not require a permit or otherwise promulgate regulations under this section or
				directly or indirectly require any State to require a permit under this section
				for a discharge of stormwater runoff resulting from the conduct of the
				following silvicultural activities: nursery operations, site preparation,
				reforestation and subsequent cultural treatment, thinning, prescribed burning,
				pest and fire control, harvesting operations, surface drainage, and road use,
				construction, and maintenance.

header.#text:
NPDES permit
				requirements for silvicultural activities

text.#text:
Nothing in this paragraph exempts a
				silvicultural activity resulting in the discharge of dredged or fill material
				from any permitting requirement under

header.#text:
Permits for
				dredged or fill material

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S971 IS: Silviculture Regulatory Consistency Act

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
